IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO ENRICH, EDUCATE AND ENTERTAIN OUR COMMUNITY THROUGH A SUPERIOR THEATRE EXPERIENCE
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO CREATE AND PERFORM AFFORDABLE, HIGH QUALITY AMATEUR THEATRE; TO ENCOURAGE PARTICIPATION IN AND APPRECIATION OF THEATRE; AND TO PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL AND ENRICHMENT OPPORTUNITIES AND OUTREACH PROGRAMS FOR ALL RESIDENTS AND VISITORS
IRS990.Desc: MAINSTAGE - THE MAINSTAGE IS THE LARGEST SPACE, PROSCENIUM STYLE, AND USED TO PRESENT MUSICALS, PLAYS, CONCERTS, AND LECTURES; AS WELL AS USED FOR THE PRESENTATION OF YOUTH PRODUCTIONS, CLASSES, AND PROGRAMS FOR CHILDREN INVOLVED IN THE EDUCATION PROGRAM. IT IS MADE AVAILABLE FOR COMMUNITY RENTAL ON DATES THAT IT IS NOT IN-USE BY THE NAPLES PLAYERS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: YOUTH THEATRE - THE YOUTH THEATRE PROGRAM KNOWN AS KIDZACT ALSO INCLUDES ADULT EDUCATION PROGRAMS. ALL PROGRAMS FOCUS ON ARTISTIC EXPRESSION & PROCESS, INDIVIDUAL VOICE, BODY AWARENESS, COMMUNICATION STYLES, DANCE AND MUSIC. IT ALSO ENCOMPASSES THE "WELLNESS THROUGH THE ARTS" PROGRAM UTILIZING THERAPEUTIC PROCESSES TO ALLOW EXPRESS, ARTS ACCESS, AND DEVELOPMENT OF CHILDREN AND ADULTS WITH A RANGE OF DISABILITILES INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO: AUTISM, SENSORY PROCESSING DISORDERS, PARKINSON'S, ALZHEIMER'S, ANXIETY & DEPRESSION, AND MORE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: STUDIO THEATRE - THE STUDIO THEATRE IS A FLEXIBLE PERFORMANCE SPACE USED TO PRESENT INTIMATE MUSICALS, PLAYS, AND LECTURES; AS WELL AS USED FOR THE PRESENTATION OF YOUTH PRODUCTIONS, CLASSES, AND PROGRAMS FOR CHILDREN INVOLVED IN THE EDUCATION PROGRAM. IT ALSO HOSTS THE READER'S THEATRE.

OtherSecuritiesGrp.Desc: BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN NET ASSETS OF OTHERS (SEE SCHEDULE O)

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION FOLLOWS THE INCOME TAX STANDARD REGARDING THE RECOGNITION AND MEASUREMENT OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. THIS GUIDANCE CLARIFIES THE ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES RECOGNIZED IN AN ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THIS STANDARD HAD NO IMPACT ON THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
FOOD AND BEVERAGE COST OF GOODS SOLD 71,702. CHANGE IN THE VALUE OF BENEFICIAL INTEREST -810,806. PLEDGES DISCOUNT -213,584.
FOOD AND BEVERAGE COST OF GOODS SOLD 71,702.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PRESIDENT, AS CHAIR, AND ALL OTHER OFFICERS, TOGETHER WITH THE IMMEDIATE PAST PRESIDENT, SHALL CONSTITUTE THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR SHALL BE PRESENT AT MEETINGS OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, UNLESS EXCUSED BY THE COMMITTEE, BUT SHALL NOT BE A MEMBER THEREOF. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL PROVIDE OVERSIGHT FOR THE ACTIONS OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, OVERSEE STRATEGIC PLANNING, AND MAY EXERCISE THE POWERS OF THE BOARD BETWEEN MEETINGS OF THE BOARD. ALL ACTIONS TAKEN SHALL BE REPORTED TO THE BOARD AT ITS NEXT MEETING. REGULAR SCHEDULED MEETINGS OR SPECIAL MEETINGS MAY BE CALLED BY THE PRESIDENT, THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, OR BY ANY TWO (2) MEMBERS OF THIS COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERSHIP IN THE CORPORATION SHALL BE OPEN TO ALL PERSONS WHO SHARE AN INTEREST AND BELIEF IN THE PURPOSES OF THE CORPORATION. EACH MEMBER MUST BE CURRENT IN THE PAYMENT OF DUES AND MEET CERTAIN MEMBERSHIP REQUIREMENTS AS ESTABLISHED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IN ORDER TO PARTICIPATE ACTIVELY AS A MEMBER OF THE CORPORATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH MEMBER WHO HAS REACHED HIS OR HER MAJORITY SHALL BE ELIGIBLE TO VOTE FOR THE ELECTION OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ELECTION OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS NOW PLACED IN THE HANDS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE MEMBERSHIP CAN STILL RECOMMEND INDIVIDUALS (SENT TO THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S 990 IS PREPARED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING BASED ON INFORMATION PROVIDED BY MANAGEMENT. THE TREASURER AND CEO/EXECUTIVE ARTISTIC DIRECTOR REVIEW A DRAFT OF THE FORM 990 AND COMPARES IT TO THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS, IN ADDITION TO REVIEWING SCHEDULES AND RESPONSES TO ALL QUESTIONS. TREASURER SIGNS THE 990.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IF A BOARD OR COMMITTEE MEMBER HAS AN INTEREST IN A PROPOSED TRANSACTION WITH TNP IN THE FORM OF A SIGNIFICANT PERSONAL OR ORGANIZATIONAL FINANCIAL INTEREST IN THE TRANSACTION OR HOLDS A POSITION AS TRUSTEE, DIRECTOR, OFFICER, OR STAFF MEMBER IN SUCH ORGANIZATION, HE OR SHE MUST MAKE FULL DISCLOSURE OF SUCH INTEREST BEFORE ANY DISCUSSION OR NEGOTIATION OF SUCH TRANSACTION. ANY BOARD OR COMMITTEE MEMBER WHO HAS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST WITH RESPECT TO ANY MATTER COMING BEFORE THE BOARD OR THE COMMITTEE SHALL NOT PARTICIPATE IN ANY DISCUSSION OF OR VOTE IN CONNECTION WITH THE MATTER UNLESS INVITED TO RESPOND TO QUESTIONS OR PROVIDE FACTUAL INFONNATION BY THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE CHAIR. ANNUALLY, BOARD MEMBERS WILL BE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE ANY BUSINESS OR PERSONAL RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN OFFICERS, TRUSTEES, KEY EMPLOYEES AND VENDORS WITH WHOM TNP CONDUCTS BUSINESS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR IS REVIEWED ON A YEARLY BASIS BY INDEPENDENT MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNING BODY. COMPARABILITY DATA TO OTHER NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS IS USED IN ORDER TO EVALUATE COMPENSATION. ALL DISCUSSION AND DELIBERATIONS ARE DOCUMENTED IN THE MINUTES OF THE MEETING OF THE INDEPENDENT MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNING BODY. THE REVIEW WAS DONE IN 2021.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF BENEFICIAL INTEREST -810,806. PLEDGES DISCOUNTS -213,584.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990 , PART XI LINE 9 AND SCHEDULE D PART VII LINE A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN 2013, THE ORGANIZATION TRANSFERRED FUNDS TO THE NAPLES PLAYERS ENDOWMENT, INC. (ENDOWMENT), A THEN NEWLY FUNDED LEGAL ENTITY. THE FUNDS TRANSFERRED WERE PRIMARILY OF FIXED INCOME AND EQUITY SECURITIES AND CASH. THE ENDOWMENT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT AND CUSTODY OF THE FUNDS AND IT USES A PROFESSIONAL INVESTMENT ADVISOR AND CUSTODIAN. THE ASSETS OF THE ENDOWMENT ARE COMPRISED PRIMARILY OF CASH, DEBT AND EQUITY SECURITIES AND MUTUAL FUNDS. THE ENDOWMENT HOLDS THE FUNDS AND SOLICITS FUNDS SOLELY FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE ORGANIZATION. ALTHOUGH THE ORGANIZATION AND ENDOWMENT SHARE SOME BOARD MEMBERS, THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT CONTROL THE ENDOWMENT. SINCE THE ENDOWMENT SOLELY SUPPORTS THE ORGANIZATION, THE ENDOWMENT IS CONSIDERED FINANCIALLY INTERRELATED TO THE ORGANIZATION. AS A RESULT, THE BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN THE ASSETS OF THE ENDOWMENT ARE RECORDED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OF THE ORGANIZATION. THE BALANCE OF THE BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN THE ASSETS OF OTHERS IS $8,670,023 AND $9,480,829 AS OF APRIL 30, 2022 AND 2021, RESPECTIVELY.
